programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Jennifer Luck said she was having a little fun when she pinched Andrew Wirth's buttocks in a bar; that pinch resulted in the deaths of Jennifer and her boyfriend Greg Peters.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Frank Jude nearly lost his life when a group of drunken off-duty Milwaukee police officers brutalized him over a missing badge; his real fight would be taking on the Blue Wall of Silence in his quest for justice.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Julie Jensen suspected her husband and the father of her children Mark Jensen wanted her dead, so she put pen to paper telling the world just that; Mark Jensen's lawyer attempts to use that same letter to prove that Julie framed him.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The legal matter of where exactly the defendant committed his second murder took up more court time; Wayne County, Michigan processed the crime scene and conducted the police investigation; therefore the trial was filed through Wayne County.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The first witness in the defense's case-in-chief was a board-certified neurologist; Dr. Harold Klawans spoke on Thomas Hyde's physical condition and battle with Lou Gehrig's disease.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The victim's little brother, Shawn Hyde, took to the stand and talked about his brother and their relationship; he testified for the defense; Shawn Hyde recalled the time Thomas confided and told his family about Lou Gehrig's disease.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The medical assistant who worked with the defendant testified; Neil Nickel recalled the death counseling he and Kevorkian underwent with Thomas Hyde; Dr. Jack Kevorkian's medical assistant was with him during the video taping.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The state continued with their cross examination on the defendant's medical assistant. Neil Nickel recalled that he and Dr. Jack Kevorkian consulted with a quote Think Tank to discuss Thomas Hyde as a candidate for voluntary euthanasia.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Dr. Stanley Levy claimed that the defendant took a heroic effort in ending the pain and suffering of Thomas Hyde; he called it New Age Hospice Care. Dr. Levy went further and called both the defendant and the victim in this case heroic.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Legal issues were brought up by the state pertaining to the defense's next witness called to testify; the defense wanted to bring a widow of one of Dr. Jack Kevorkian's past patients for physician-assisted suicide.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: A widow in one of Dr. Jack Kevorkian's past cases of voluntary euthanasia took the stand outside the jury's presence.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors watched plenty of surveillance footage pinpointing Scott Nelson's movements out of town just hours after Jennifer Fulford disappeared.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: A Walmart employee took the stand. Prosecutors wanted to confirm the items Scott Nelson brought before he allegedly killed Jennifer Fulford. Among the items were the knife he allegedly used in the fatal stabbing.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: The State brought in another Crime Scene investigator to testify to the jury. Investigators examined the crime scene where Jennifer Fulford's body was found and thoroughly processed key evidence looking for important clues to her Murder.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: More physical evidence found inside Jennifer Fulford's car was shown to jurors. Three months to the exact date that she went missing crime scene investigators found the murder weapon used in her killing.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors learned about the whereabouts of the keys to the car where the kidnapping and fatal stabbing took place. Apparently, the defendant wrote to one of the Detectives and informed them exactly where they were located.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors delivered the DNA evidence linking the defendant to the fatal stabbing and suffocation of Jennifer Fulford. On the stand, was the stand was the biology lab analyst who examined the forensic evidence collected in this case.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Under cross-examination, Matthew McCabe recalls how confusing everything was during that time the defendant called his wife in the middle of the night screaming about not finding her boyfriend.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Karen Read's attorney butts heads with Matthew McCabe under cross-examination; he was Jennifer McCabe's husband, who was key to this case; discussing how often the black SUV did move in the driveway of the Albert family home.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: The Guy Never Went in the House
programme.desc: The testimony of Matthew McCabe wraps up; the Defense brings up a number of text messages he sent before and after John O'Keefe died.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jennifer McCabe is the woman who called 911 after the discovery of John O'Keefe's body; she takes the stand in Karen Read's murder trial; McCabe was with the defendant when they discovered the body.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors listen to more testimony from the State's key witness; Jennifer McCabe was with Karen Read when they came across John O'Keefe in the snow; McCabe claims the defendant and her boyfriend got into a fight.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: I Hit Him, I Hit Him
programme.desc: The State's key witness gives jurors her account of how the defendant reacted when they searched for John O'Keefe; Jennifer McCabe claims the defendant admitted to having a fight with the victim just hours before he appeared in the snow.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Jeffery Pyne was every parent's dream in so many ways, so many wonder what drove him to commit the brutal murder of his own mother.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Nancy Seaman doesn't denied killing her husband Robert with a hatchet; either she planned it or the murder was a desperate attempt to save her own life after, what she claims, was three decades of physical and emotional abuse.
